title: Eth1RequestException: Eth1 call has failed:missing trie node
body:
### Description
Trying to bootstrap a new testnet. Teku does not do anything. Maybe because it's prior to genesis time?

### Steps to Reproduce (Bug)
https://github.com/goerli/schlesi/tree/master/teku

* connect a teku node to a geth node
* teku eth1_follow_distance is 1024
* geth tries_in_memory value is 128

**Expected behavior:** [What you expect to happen]

It should launch the beacon node and validators.

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happens]

It doesn't do anything for more than 40 minutes:

```
~/.opt/PegaSysEng/teku master 15m 16s
❯ 
teku \
--config-file="/home/user/.opt/goerli/witti/teku/config.yaml" \
--network="/home/user/.opt/goerli/witti/teku/chain.yaml"


^C^C^C^C^C^C^C^C^C^C^C^C^C^C
^C

~/.opt/PegaSysEng/teku master 43m 55s
❯ 
teku \
--config-file="/home/user/.opt/goerli/witti/teku/config.yaml" \
--network="/home/user/.opt/goerli/witti/teku/chain.yaml"

```

**Frequency:** 1

### Versions (Add all that apply)
* Software version: `teku/v0.11.2-dev-982608ec/linux-x86_64/oracle_openjdk-java-11`
* Java version: `openjdk version "11.0.6" 2020-01-14`
* OS Name & Version: `NAME="Arch Linux"`
* Kernel Version: `Linux ceres 5.6.10-arch1-1 #1 SMP PREEMPT Sat, 02 May 2020 19:11:54 +0000 x86_64 GNU/Linux`

I'm surprised it's completely silent. If it started running it should at least print something like:
```
2020-05-20 06:41:17,131 main INFO Configuring logging for destination: console and file
2020-05-20 06:41:17,134 main INFO Logging file location: /Users/aj/Library/teku/logs/teku.log
2020-05-20 06:41:17,134 main INFO Logging includes events: true
2020-05-20 06:41:17,134 main INFO Logging includes color: true
06:41:17.188 INFO  - Using data path: /Users/aj/Library/teku/data
06:41:17.202 INFO  - Initializing storage
```

I note that in the config file at https://raw.githubusercontent.com/goerli/schlesi/master/teku/config.yaml it has `Xinterop-enabled: true` which will cause Teku to generate a genesis with deterministically generated validator keys but since `Xinterop-owned-validator-count` isn't set, it won't be running any of the validators and the genesis time is still a fair way in the future.

With interop mode disabled it's connecting to the ETH1 chain and finding 66% of the required validators for genesis.

There is likely a log file in `~/.local/teku/logs/teku.log` which may provide more detail as well.
Make sure you delete any existing database as well - otherwise if the db contains an interop genesis it will start from that again and still be waiting for the genesis time.
I deleted the database and removed the interop options from the config file, it still does not do anything.

I read this in the log file, still strange that this is not printed to stdout:


Those exceptions indicate that the cache of `Eth1Data` information is failing to read from the historical world state - likely the ETH1 node is pruning and with the long follow distance the blocks ETH2 is looking at no longer have world state available.  We've got some work happening currently in our ETH1 integration which will avoid this but it's probably at least a week away yet.  That might affect validators producing blocks, but it shouldn't stop us reaching genesis.

Could you give me the full output and log so I can see exactly what teku is doing?  For me, Teku is generating genesis for Witti and starts processing (empty) slots.

I'm nowhere near these logs before Monday.

Meanwhile, I'm seeing this in Geth:

```
INFO [05-22|14:00:32.443] Imported new chain segment               blocks=1    txs=5    mgas=0.837   elapsed=28.714ms    mgasps=29.165   number=2741071 hash="cbbdd0…5e50f7" dirty=80.92MiB

```

How can I fix this? I'm running with `--syncmode full` and `--gcmode full`.

ref https://github.com/ethereum/eth2.0-specs/issues/1839

would it be possible to rely on deposit logs instead of the entire state?

![Screenshot at 2020-05-22 14-50-05](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/58883403/82669434-b6acc180-9c3b-11ea-8935-58ec22df0ab5.png)
Yes, totally. We are aware of this issue and the solution. @ajsutton has just picked it up due to its urgency.
Manually hacking Geth to retain 1024 states fixed that for me.
